title: How to Win a Multiplayer Match in Star Fox: Command

steps.headline: Complete all training exercises and at least one story path.
steps.description: If you cannot defeat computer-controlled enemies, then you will not stand a chance against a skilled opponent in a multi-player match. Use the first training exercise (the objective in this mode is to fly through a series of rings) to master the control scheme fully.

steps.headline: Make sure you are holding your DS firmly and position in such a way so that sudden vibrations (if you are playing in a moving vehicle or with a rumble pack) or shifting will not shake the screen.
steps.description: This is essential- a screen that is not steady translates to erratic movements and can be fatal.

steps.headline: Ensure that you have a stylus or pin-point control for the touch screen.
steps.description: Whatever you may think or insist, your finger will not work in a tough fight-- it will hurt you more than help you (it will likely obscure half of the screen).

steps.headline: Once the battle begins, your first two priorities are to obtain the laser upgrade or the stealth mode.
steps.description: The twin lasers have a higher rate of fire and move more rapidly, but plasma shots are more powerful, if slightly slower. The cloak will mask your movements and in a multi-player battle will offer you a relief when your shields are nearing collapse.

steps.headline: If you are in a battle with more than one opponent, choose one and come in behind them.
steps.description: Do not allow anyone to circle in behind you.

steps.headline: Open fire immediately by holding down any button for approximately one second.
steps.description: Do not rapidly tap the controls-- holding down a button for a short period of time will fire three bursts very quickly. Do not attempt to shoot down an opponent with a locked shot.

steps.headline: Continue firing until your target has been destroyed, then barrel roll quickly to obtain the kill point (the gold star), bank away, and select another target.

text: Complete all training exercises and at least one story path. If you cannot defeat computer-controlled enemies, then you will not stand a chance against a skilled opponent in a multi-player match. Use the first training exercise (the objective in this mode is to fly through a series of rings) to master the control scheme fully. Make sure you are holding your DS firmly and position in such a way so that sudden vibrations (if you are playing in a moving vehicle or with a rumble pack) or shifting will not shake the screen. This is essential- a screen that is not steady translates to erratic movements and can be fatal. Ensure that you have a stylus or pin-point control for the touch screen. Whatever you may think or insist, your finger will not work in a tough fight-- it will hurt you more than help you (it will likely obscure half of the screen). Once the battle begins, your first two priorities are to obtain the laser upgrade or the stealth mode. The twin lasers have a higher rate of fire and move more rapidly, but plasma shots are more powerful, if slightly slower. The cloak will mask your movements and in a multi-player battle will offer you a relief when your shields are nearing collapse. If you are in a battle with more than one opponent, choose one and come in behind them. Do not allow anyone to circle in behind you. Open fire immediately by holding down any button for approximately one second. Do not rapidly tap the controls-- holding down a button for a short period of time will fire three bursts very quickly. Do not attempt to shoot down an opponent with a locked shot. Continue firing until your target has been destroyed, then barrel roll quickly to obtain the kill point (the gold star), bank away, and select another target.
